data.title: Amazing beer selections and really good food
data.text: 60 beers on tap and 500 varieties in bottles or cans !  Add to that some very good pub food and you have the makings of a place worth visiting if you are near College Station.  I tried the "local sampler" of 4 beers from nearby brewers.  All were good and each quite different.  For dinner I had the pork schnitzel, with a fried egg and capers on top all sitting on a bed of mashed potatoes and accompanied by a mixture of kale and red onions.  Very tasty !

data.title: Good beer; decent food
data.text: interesting menu selections; friendly service. Way too noisy for any conversation. Everyone at our table was hoarse the next day, as we had to shout to try to converse.

data.title: Pretty awesome food
data.text: They have some great beer selections, finger foods and a wide assortment of "tavern shares". The flat bread BBQ chicken is insanely good.

data.title: Food Alert
data.text: We have a World of Beer here in San Antonio but it does not serve food.  My expectations thus set by previous experience, I was gratified and surprised to find that here in Aggieland, WOB has food.  Good food.  Plentiful food.  We were attending a baseball game last March and popped in just for a beer.  We stayed and had lots of fun.  The beer selection is terrific and service excellent.  We will be back.  Our new fav.

data.title: Good selection of beers
data.text: So a very nice selection of beers and the waiters (at least the ones I've had) seem sufficiently knowledgeable. The food is so-so. If your hungry and want some food with your beer it is better than most, but I wouldn't plan to come here for dinner.

data.title: lots of beer
data.text: I was in this bar with my friend and we were satisfied. It is really a good place for drinking beer. Thera are a diversity of beer blends.At the end of our party, we voted and weat belgium style beer we agreed as the best one.

data.title: No cold mugs?!?
data.text: We were very disappointed to find out that they do not have cold mugs for draft beer. The selection is amazing and food was great but if I have to drink sort of cold beer I will always be a little disappointed.

data.title: Hot weather but COLD beer
data.text:
Came into town to drop my daughter off at a scholarship camp.  Stayed just down the street from World of Beer. Dropped in for a quick beer and a bite to eat. 

"My man" Darien was super, suggested a great beer that was also on the happy hour list. Followed up with a wonderful bratwurst that was also on the Monday Special.  

This was the best $12.00 I spent on food in a long time. Great meal, cold beer and wonderful service. Good job WOB.  I hope my daughter selects TAMU so I can come back again....

data.title: Beer...and now food!
data.text: I'd been to other World of Beer's before, but this one serves food.  Maybe it's a new concept for the chain.  Wish I would have known that before.  Had a great waiter who recommended several beers with some associated complimentary small tastings.  He went out of his way to ensure I picked an appropriate beer from the multitude of offerings.  The only drawback is the relatively steep prices.

data.title: Good food! Good Beer!
data.text:
Late dinner and drinks on the patio. 
Large menu of food and beer.
Cool atmosphere. Even had corn hole games outside!
Good Service.

data.title: good craft beer and gastropub food
data.text: I ate here twice on a business trip chosen mostly for its proximity to my hotel.  They have 50 beers on tap and had no trouble finding ones to my liking.   I tried the burgers and tacos, and they were above average and in line with the gastropub vibe of the place.  Service at the bar was very swift and attentive.  Lots of big TVs for sports viewing.  Overall a good experience for its category.

data.title: Great beer, poor prices
data.text:
We were excited when this place first came to town, and love the atmopshere and the beer selections.  However, I'd have to say that they pretty much have the worst prices on craft beer in town, I ordered a single Westmalle tripel 12oz bottle the other day that cost SIXTEEN DOLLARS...

staff are very friendly, but not always very knowledgeable about the product if you're looking for a recommendation.

data.title: Good Food & Beer -Horrible Service
data.text: First visit to World of Beer - Food was great! Burgers were awesome and the buns are the best! Now Beer, the main reason you stop by this place .. So many choices!! It's almost overwhelming! The beer menu is very detailed which helps! Beer was cold and all the ones we tried were excellent!! The atmosphere is fun, there are a lot of tv's with different sports playing. Now for the bad ... The service! Horrible. Our waiter was awful! Slow, forgetful, disappeared for long periods of time. The table next to us was having the same problem. We would have stayed longer and had a few more beer but the waiter was horrible and we were ready to go. Go for the food and beer - and keep your fingers crossed your service is better!

data.title: Too many choices!
data.text: Not only can you enjoy sampling all kinds of beer and ale, but their lunch menu was really tasty!  There was a good variety of food selections, and my group was very pleased.  It was fun to sample all sorts of beverages.

data.title: Possibly the best place to drink beer in BCS
data.text:
Why the subject title? Because WOB does what i like: provide multiple styles to customers. All too often I'll go to a bar or brewpub and be confronted with nothing but multiple IPAs, or some such silliness. Yes WOB is a chain, but it has a great range of Texas beers in this location. I like the sour beers and there are always 3-4 on the list.They run great seasonal offerings too.

The food is nice...actual small plates things you can share. In fact WOB may be the closest thing to a tapas bar in town...but that bar is very low.

Service is very erratic and inconsistent, and that's really the only fly in the ointment here. Great loyalty program, great fun vibe...we love having work happy hours here.

data.title: What a Beer List
data.text: I have never been to a World of Beer before. On my way back to my hotel after dinner, I decided to stop in and see what it was all about. Man, what a place. There is a large draft list and an even bigger bottle and can list. From Miller Lite to Imperial stout's, with cider in between, if you can't find something you like you probably don't drink. I had a double IPA from Texas that was quite excellent.

data.title: Wide Variety of Beer
data.text: If you are looking for a specific beer, they probably have it here.  Beer is sorted by country and that have a ton to choose from.  Service at the bar was surprisingly slow since there were not that many people there.  I ordered the grille chicken Caesar salad which was very good.  They have quite a few TV's located throughout the restaurant and the overall setting is casual.

data.title: This is a WORLD beer.
data.text: This place is brand new. They have h-u-g-e selection of beers. Perfect to hang for a couple of hours. Was there twice and will go again.

data.title: Finally a good pub with a worthy beer selection!
data.text:
College Station is a place of extremes: Either you head to The Republic where you enjoy a cocktail at an up-tight bar, or you go to the Fox & Hound for a crappy beer with all surfaces being sticky (not to mention the crappy food). Finally, there is a place in town that has good beers and a nice atmosphere!

Let me start by stating the the beer selection is excellent. If you are into German beers, you will not be disappointed. Food is good and, to be honest, the pretzel was the best I have had in the US. 

Service was friendly and nice, but a little slow. I presume it is because the place is still figuring things out in this college town.

I will be back. Often. Awesome. Excited.
